trans-unit.source: Provides behavior for the component tray of a designer.
The component tray represents components that do not otherwise provide a visible surface at design time and provides a way for users to access and set the properties of those components.
Some types of components, such as a <xref:System.Timers.Timer>, may not have a user interface that can be viewed at design time.
These components are usually represented by icons that are shown in the component tray.
The component tray is a rectangular region displayed at the bottom of the design view window while in design view mode, once it is active.
The component tray becomes active in design view after a component that is displayed in the component tray has been added to or is part of the current document.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentTray"></xref> class using the specified designer and service provider.
The component tray monitors component additions and removals and displays appropriate user interface objects to represent the components it contains.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner"></xref> that is the main or document designer for the current project.
An <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref> that can be used to obtain design-time services.
Adds a component to the tray.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> to add to the tray.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tray items are automatically aligned.
`true` if the tray items are automatically arranged; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified tool can be used to create a new component.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to test.
`true` if the specified tool can be used to create a component; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified component can be displayed.

This method tests the specified component for the existence of a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignTimeVisibleAttribute>, which indicates whether the component has a user interface that can be displayed.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> to test.
`true` if the component can be displayed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of components contained in the tray.
The number of components in the tray.
Creates a component from the specified toolbox item, adds the component to the current document, and displays a representation for the component in the component tray.
This method checks the item for an appropriate <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignTimeVisibleAttribute> before attempting to create the component and add it to the component tray.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to create a component from.
Displays an error message to the user with information about the specified exception.
The exception about which to display information.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentTray"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentTray> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets the location of the specified component, relative to the upper-left corner of the component tray.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentTray.GetLocation%2A> is an accessor method for the location extender property that is added to each component in the component tray.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> to retrieve the location of.

A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> indicating the coordinates of the specified component, or an empty <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> if the specified component could not be found in the component tray.

An empty <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> has an <xref href="System.Drawing.Point.IsEmpty"></xref> property equal to `true` and typically has <xref href="System.Drawing.Point.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Drawing.Point.Y"></xref> properties that are each equal to zero.

Similar to <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.GetNextControl(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Boolean)"></xref>, this method returns the next component in the tray, given a starting component.
The component from which to start enumerating.
`true` to enumerate forward through the list; otherwise, `false` to enumerate backward.
The next component in the component tray, or `null`, if the end of the list is encountered (or the beginning, if forward is `false`).
Gets the requested service type.
The type of the service to retrieve.
An instance of the requested service, or `null` if the service could not be found.
Gets the value of the `Location` extender property.
The `Location` extender property is offered to all non-visual components.
The returned value takes into account the value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.AutoScrollPosition%2A>.
If `receiver` does not have a component view, the returned value is an empty <xref:System.Drawing.Point>.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> that receives the location extender property.
A representing the location of receiver.
Tests a component for presence in the component tray.
The component to test for presence in the component tray.
`true` if comp is being shown on the tray; otherwise, `false`.
Called when an object that has been dragged is dropped on the component tray.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Called when an object is dragged over, and has entered the area over, the component tray.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Called when an object is dragged out of the area over the component tray.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Called when an object is dragged over the component tray.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Called during an OLE drag and drop operation to provide an opportunity for the component tray to give feedback to the user about the results of dropping the object at a specific point.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GiveFeedbackEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Layout"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LayoutEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Called when a mouse drag selection operation is canceled.
Called when the mouse is double clicked over the component tray.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Called when the mouse button is pressed.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Called when the mouse cursor position has changed.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Called when the mouse button has been released.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Called when the view for the component tray should be refreshed.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs"></xref> that provides data for the event.
Called to set the mouse cursor.
Removes the specified component from the tray.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> to remove from the tray.
Sets the location of the specified component to the specified location.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> to set the location of.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> indicating the new location for the specified component.
Sets the value of the `Location` extender property.
The `Location` extender property is offered to all non-visual components.
The actual value takes into account the value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.AutoScrollPosition%2A>.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> that receives the location extender property.
A representing the location of receiver.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tray displays a large icon to represent each component in the tray.
`true` if large icons are displayed; otherwise, `false`.
Processes Windows messages.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IExtenderProvider.CanExtend(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentTray> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IExtenderProvider> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to receive the extender properties.
`true` if this object can provide extender properties to the specified object; otherwise, `false`.
